newsitem.title: GERMANY: German oilseeds crush lower in 1996 - ministry.
newsitem.headline: German oilseeds crush lower in 1996 - ministry.

text.p: German oilseeds crushings in 1996 totalled 7.35 million tonnes, 4.3 percent down from the 1995 volume, the Bonn farm ministry said in a weekly circular.
Some 2.13 million tonnes, or 29 percent, of the processed volume were domestic crops (2.42 million 1995), the ministry said, citing official processor figures.
The seed total allowed for wastage and water losss during processing.

Crushers produced 2.27 million tonnes of vegetable oils from the seeds in 1996 (2.35 million 1995), of which rapeseed oil, at 1.37 million tonnes, was the leading commodity (1.35 million 1995), rounded.
Sun oil output amounted to 180,000 tonnes (200,000), soy oil for 590,000 tonnes (630,000) and other oils for 130,000 (170,000).
Crushers in 1996 also produced 5.02 million tonnes of meals (5.27 million previously).

Soy meal accounted for 2.67 million tonnes (2.81 million), rape meal for 1.95 million (1.94), sun meal for 231,000 (272,000), with the remainder made up of lin meal, corn germ meal, copra meal and others.
